alert.note: Alert for Western Greenbrier (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 17 at 8:58PM EDT until April 18 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 8 PM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow and sleet accumulations of up to two inches with ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Western Greenbrier County. * WHEN...From 1 AM to 8 PM EDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Untreated roads and surface, especially at the higher elevations of the mountains, could become snow covered, slick, and hazardous. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute.
info.instruction: A Winter Weather Advisory means that periods of snow...sleet...or freezing rain will cause travel difficulties. Be prepared for slippery roads and limited visibilities...and use caution while driving. Please report snow, sleet and/or ice accumulations to the National Weather Service in Blacksburg, VA. Reports can be submitted via phone by calling 1-866-215-4324, through our social media platforms, by email at rnk.skywarn@noaa.gov, or online at www.weather.gov/rnk.
